title: Stocks stumble lower at the open as investors await crucial decision on interest rates from the Fed
text: U.S. stock markets slipped at the open Wednesday as investors watched for a widely expected interest-rate cut from the Federal Reserve, while a flood of quarterly corporate results continued apace and a reading of the health of the domestic economy came in better than expected. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.09% was at 27,038, down 0.1%, the S&P 500 index SPX, -0.06% edged 0.1% lower at 3,034, and the Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, -0.10% ticked down 0.1% to 8,270. The Federal Reserve's Jerome Powell and the rate-setting Federal Open Market Committee will release its policy update later at 2 p.m. Eastern Time, with Powell slated to discuss the central bank's policy a half-hour later. A quarter percentage point cut to a 1.50%-1.75% range is expected by the FOMC. Meanwhile, a report on private-sector employment came showed that Private-sector employers added 125,000 jobs were created in October, according to payroll-processor Automatic Data Processing Inc. ADP, -2.29%, matching consensus estimates. GDP showed an annual increase of 1.9%. On the earnings fronts, quarterly results from Apple Inc. AAPL, +0.07% are expected later Wednesday. Investors also watched for a second day of Congressional hearings from Boeing Co.'s BA, +0.22% CEO after centered on a pair of fatal crashes of the aviation company's 737 MAX jets.
